caption.p: Key ‘Factors’ identified within articles divided by cognitive themes and their origination

td.p: Extensive coverage of factors. Focus includes individual attributes (personal, moral and practice related), business operational factors (including financial, system and capability based) and implications of pressures from society
Past experience of success/ Failure. Success may lead to over prioritisation of primary stakeholders e.g. customers and under prioritisation of secondary stakeholders
Perceived moral intensity of environmental problem
Perceived importance of the ethical issue and context
Ethics Ethical leader with authority to act Behavioural control
Level of past corporate experience. Experience changes approach to a problem. Expert and novice differ in cognitive structure and way gather information and evaluate Job tenure
Personality traits e.g. need for closure tolerance for ambiguity
Connection to action and brand image and legitimacy
Company culture guiding employee conduct and attitudes including values, principles, believes, enviro economic, participation level
Business processes allow individuals to create meaning
Environmental managers attitude to stakeholder groups;
Environmental strategy Ethics embedded in governance strategies and ‘‘concerned with authenticity and change, power and authority, leadership, imagination and the creation of sustainable value’’
Institutional information availability motivation and resource bundles
Business pressure from e.g. customers, community; suppliers, competitors, and financial institutions
Stakeholder pressure from e.g. NGOs. media, governments, public organisations and local agencies.
Formal stakeholder pressure e.g. law, regulation and policy and informal pressure e.g. institutions and social networks
Social pressure. High social pressure can lead to expensive fines, clean-up costs etc
Focus on morality and social connection. Language and influence of others important
Taken for granted knowledge Recurrent practices
Operationally focussed while including concept of responsibility to society
Environmental issue legitimation as part of corporate identity
Connotation as "environmental leader" creates positive environmental associations
Perceived role in society and approach to climate change through concept of responsibility
